intro: Inga calantha, commonly known as the purple-leaf inga, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, violet or purple flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its rapid growth and nitrogen-fixing ability make it an important component of ecological restoration projects.
